sentences.en: a doctor who has been accused of professional misconduct
sentences.cn: 被指控玩忽职守的医生

sentences.en: And nationwide, male teachers still commit far more sexual misconduct than females.
sentences.cn: 而且从全国看来, 男性老师的性犯罪要远远超过了女老师.

sentences.en: Aren't you just using Akira as camouflage to cover up your misconduct?
sentences.cn: 你是不是在利用亚基拉掩饰你的办事不力?

sentences.en: Capitals are increased by parsimony, and diminished by prodigality and misconduct.
sentences.cn: 节俭使资本增长, 挥霍和运用不当使资本减少.

sentences.en: Church takes accusations of sexual misconduct extremely seriously.
sentences.cn: 教会非常严厉看待不检点性行为的控诉.

sentences.en: Death penalty is usually imposed because of some type of gross misconduct.
sentences.cn: 死刑经常只对某类别的严重犯罪惩处.

sentences.en: He was fired for serious misconduct .
His misconduct let in a host of troubles.
sentences.cn: 他的不端行为招致不少麻烦.

sentences.en: How are employees disciplined for misconduct or poor performance?
sentences.cn: 如果工人有不端行为或恶劣的表现会受到什麽处分?

sentences.en: I acquit Edward of all essential misconduct.
sentences.cn: 我原谅爱德华的所有根本过错.

sentences.en: If prosecutorial misconduct results in a mistrial, a later prosecution may be barred.
sentences.cn: 如果检察官的不轨行为导致审判无效, 再行起诉可能会被除数禁止.

sentences.en: She was found guilty of gross misconduct (= very serious misconduct ) .
sentences.cn: 她被裁定犯有严重失职罪。

sentences.en: The accountant is guilty of gross misconduct and he will be prosecuted.
sentences.cn: 这个会计犯了重大失误,将会被起诉.

sentences.en: The boy's misconduct cost his mother many sleepless nights.
sentences.cn: 这男孩的不轨行为,使他的母亲许多夜不得安眠.

sentences.en: The doctor was found guilty of professional misconduct.
sentences.cn: 那个医生由于职业上的不端行为而被判有罪.

sentences.en: The misconduct of the business resulted in a loss of 10,000 dollars.
sentences.cn: 管理不当,以至损失了一万美金.

sentences.en: The teachers will handle any student misconduct regarding routine problems.
sentences.cn: 下课铃响后,要等老师宣布下课后,才可离开教室.

sentences.en: They will consider whether or not he has been guilty of serious professional misconduct.
sentences.cn: 他们将考虑他是否犯有玩忽职守的重大过失。

phrases.tran_cn: 故意的不良行为 条约法律；渎职

trans.tran_cn: 行为不正，不规矩，处理不当，（尤指官吏等的）胡作非为，渎职
trans.tran_en: bad or dishonest behaviour by someone in a position of authority or trust
